intro: Astragalus chloodes, commonly known as the greenstem milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and the Middle East. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its root system is extensive, allowing it to thrive in nutrient-poor soils. Astragalus chloodes is also valued for its ecological role in stabilizing soil and supporting pollinator populations.
